lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Kings made another move in their rebuilding process yesterday, acquiring goaltender Dan Cloutier from the Vancouver Canucks for two draft picks. Cloutier played in 13 games with the Canucks, recording an 8-3-1 record with a 3.17 goals-against average before sustaining a season-ending knee injury in a game at Anaheim on Nov. 20.
